result.execSummary:
The defendant Aimee Anne Helwig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Aimee Anne Helwig is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Aimee Anne Helwig was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court witholds sentence DE is placed on 3 years probation, conditions of probation:  6 months county jail with Huber, report to jail today 8-3-16 by 2:00 pm.  DE entitled to good time. OWI assessment within 72 hours and AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.  $1694.00 fine/costs,   DEF MUST PROVIDE DNA SAMPLE and pay applicable $ 250 surcharge which is included in these costs.  DE to maintain contact with health care professional for care and medication.   Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  DL revoked 27 months plus 6 months, IID 27 months effective 45 days.
DL revoked 27 months plus 6 months.    DOT to credit any administrative suspension and add any period of incarceration to revocation sentence.
IID 27 months on any vehicle owned or operated.

Probation is revoked. 
Court sentences 1 year county jail, credit for 274 days, time served.   Def. must provide DNA sample if not already provided. Any financial obligations not paid while on probation are converted to clerk of court collect and judgment taken.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Aimee Anne Helwig in court with attorney James McLaughlin.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
No additions or corrections to PSI. State argues recommendation.  Atty McLaughlin argues proposal/joint recommendation. Def addresses court. 
Court adresses DEF.  Court addresses parties. 
Court sentences 1 year county jail, credit for 274 days, time served. $ 694.00 is converted to judgment.   Def. must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $ 250 surcharge if not already done.
Letter from State Public Defender dated 6-21-17
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 14, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Aimee Anne Helwig in court with attorney James McLaughlin.  Defendant Aimee Anne Helwig in custody.  Aaron Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   OFF THE RECORD.  Sentencing after revocation hearing needs to be rescheduled due to time constraint of calendar.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for June 23, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 26, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Notice given to DE in Sawyer County Jail
Notice NOT sent to Atty Kurta.  He has been removed as Atty.
Associated with Charge #1
Associated with Charge #1
DNA submission acknowledgement form
Voter ineligibility notice and acknowledgment
Notice of right to seek postconviction relief.

Defendant Aimee Anne Helwig in court with attorney Vincent Kurta.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both parties received PSI and have no objections or corrections.   Atty Marcoux makes recommendation.  Atty Kurta makes statement, agrees with joint recommendation of jail with no probation. DE makes statement.  
Court makes statement, insists on requiring DE to obtain treatment either in prison or on probation.  Court briefly recesses for DE to confer with counsel.  
Court witholds sentence, DE is placed on 3 years probation, conditions of probation:  6 months county jail with Huber, report to jail today 8-3-16 by 2:00 pm.  DE entitled to good time. OWI assessment within 72 hours and AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.  $1694.00 fine/costs,   DEF MUST PROVIDE DNA SAMPLE and pay applicable $ 250 surcharge which is included in these costs.  DE to maintain contact with health care professional for care and medication.   Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  DL revoked 27 months plus 6 months, IID 27 months effective 45 days.
$500 bond to be forwarded to DOC for payment of obligations.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant Aimee Anne Helwig in court with attorney Vincent Scott Kurta.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Judge John Yackel addressed the court, has conflict with case, will prepare application for Specific Judicial Assignment.   Case 15TR763 tracking along
DEF given a copy of Complaint as directed by DA in court.
State appeared by Atty Poquette.  Atty Martin Jarvis makes special appearance - bond continues waiting for results.

Standard STOP Program Conditions:
Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons.
Defendant shall not consume alcoholic beverages or illegal drugs.
Defendant shall not drive without a valid drivers license.
Defendant is ordered to report to Health and Human Services at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI within 48 hours (excluding weekends and holidays) upon release from custody to schedule an intake with a STOP case manager (715-638-3317)for the purpose of  learning about the Court's intoxicated driver intervention program.  Failure to appear may result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, a bond modification hearing, possible bail jumping charges and / or forfeiture of any bond deposit.
Defendant appeared in person in custody and via video.  Atty John Yackel appears for the state.  Court finds probable cause and sets bail and $500.00 cash bal with stop conditions
